tasks.title: Rules around how to give me commands
tasks.description: There should be a specific commands document where commands are entered for external services like servers. Commands should only be entered as they will be copied and pasted onto the server, no notes about the commands to make efficient copy and paste. Commands should be added to the document in groups that can be copied and pasted (and run) together. If they cannot, a simple line break between the commands will indicate that these need to be run separately.

tasks.title: 1. Design: Define core optimization algorithm approach
tasks.description: Choose optimization algorithm (Grid Search with Monte Carlo validation). Define search space boundaries (leverage 1-15x, risk 0-50%). Document mathematical foundation and Kelly Criterion adaptation.

tasks.title: 2. Design: Create data models and interfaces
tasks.description: Define TypeScript interfaces for: OptimizationConfig, OptimizationResult, ScenarioRanking, SensitivityAnalysis. Document input/output structures.

tasks.title: 3. Core Logic: Implement grid search engine
tasks.description: Build function to iterate through all leverage/risk combinations. Test with small grid (3x3) before full implementation. Handle edge cases (zero values, extreme parameters).

tasks.title: 4. Core Logic: Implement single scenario calculator
tasks.description: Create function to calculate: net profit, return %, position size, TP/SL amounts for given parameters. Include fee calculations. Validate against existing scenario analysis logic.

tasks.title: 5. Core Logic: Implement sequential losses safety check
tasks.description: Calculate maximum sequential losses that could occur. Check if scenario would survive worst-case losing streak. Use binomial probability for confidence intervals.

tasks.title: 6. Core Logic: Implement probability of ruin calculation
tasks.description: Calculate how many consecutive losses would wipe out account. Compute probability of hitting that many losses. Return as percentage risk metric.

tasks.title: 7. Core Logic: Implement scenario ranking algorithm
tasks.description: Sort scenarios by absolute profit (primary). Add secondary ranking options (risk-adjusted, Sharpe ratio). Filter out scenarios with negative expected value.

tasks.title: 8. Core Logic: Implement sensitivity analysis engine
tasks.description: Run optimization with 20% parameter variations. Test: win rate lower, movement lower, fees higher, worst case (all three). Compare results to base case.

tasks.title: 9. Core Logic: Add performance optimization
tasks.description: Implement search granularity control (0.5 steps vs 0.1 steps). Add progress tracking for long-running optimizations. Consider Web Worker for heavy computations.

tasks.title: 10. Testing: Create unit tests for calculations
tasks.description: Test: required capital calculation, risk/reward ratios, probability calculations, edge cases (100% win rate, 0% win rate). Verify math accuracy.

tasks.title: 11. Frontend: Create new OptimizationEngine.vue component
tasks.description: Set up new Vue component structure. Add to router with path /optimization-engine. Create basic layout skeleton with input/output sections.

tasks.title: 12. Frontend: Build input configuration panel
tasks.description: Create form inputs for: available capital, number of trades, win rate (95-99%), asset movement %, fees %. Add validation and helpful tooltips. Use sliders + number inputs.

tasks.title: 13. Frontend: Build search parameters section
tasks.description: Add controls for: leverage range (1-15x), risk range (0.5-50%), search granularity slider. Include 'Run Optimization' button with loading state.

tasks.title: 14. Frontend: Design results table component
tasks.description: Create sortable table showing: rank, leverage, risk %, net profit, return %, max loss, ruin probability, profile tag. Make columns sortable. Add row highlighting on hover.

tasks.title: 15. Frontend: Implement scenario detail modal/panel
tasks.description: Show expanded view when clicking a scenario. Display: all parameters, expected outcome breakdown, risk metrics, break-even win rate. Add 'Run Sensitivity' button.

tasks.title: 16. Frontend: Build sensitivity analysis display
tasks.description: Create comparison table for: base case vs win rate -20%, movement -20%, fees +20%, worst case. Highlight scenarios that turn negative. Show warnings.

tasks.title: 17. Frontend: Add progress indicator
tasks.description: Show progress bar during optimization. Display: scenarios tested, time elapsed, estimated time remaining. Allow cancellation of long-running searches.

tasks.title: 18. Frontend: Implement profile tagging
tasks.description: Auto-categorize scenarios as: Conservative (low leverage, low risk), Moderate, Aggressive (high leverage, high risk). Color-code badges in results table.

tasks.title: 19. Frontend: Add visual warning system
tasks.description: Highlight scenarios with: probability of ruin >1%, max drawdown >30%, negative expected value if parameters off by 10%. Use color coding (red/yellow/green).

tasks.title: 20. UI/UX: Style results table
tasks.description: Apply professional styling to results table. Add zebra striping, hover effects, clickable rows. Make responsive for mobile. Add sticky header for scrolling.

tasks.title: 21. UI/UX: Add helpful info tooltips
tasks.description: Add (i) icons with explanations for: probability of ruin, Kelly criterion, break-even rate, max sequential losses. Explain metrics in plain English.

tasks.title: 22. UI/UX: Create preset buttons
tasks.description: Add quick presets: 'Conservative Search' (1-5x, 0.5-5%), 'Moderate Search' (3-10x, 2-15%), 'Aggressive Search' (5-15x, 5-50%). Set reasonable defaults.

tasks.title: 23. Integration: Pull default values from dashboard
tasks.description: Fetch current statistics from /api/statistics endpoint. Pre-populate: capital (current balance), win rate (from SL hits), avg movement, fees. Allow manual override.

tasks.title: 24. Integration: Add navigation link
tasks.description: Add 'Profit Optimization' nav link in header. Update router configuration. Ensure proper active state highlighting. Test navigation flow.

tasks.title: 25. Testing: Manual test all input combinations
tasks.description: Test with: min values, max values, decimals, rapid changes. Verify calculations stay accurate. Check for UI bugs or lag.

tasks.title: 26. Testing: Test sensitivity analysis
tasks.description: Run sensitivity on multiple scenarios. Verify 20% variations calculate correctly. Check that warnings appear appropriately.

tasks.title: 27. Testing: Performance test with large grids
tasks.description: Test full range search (15x leverage  100 risk steps = 1500 scenarios). Measure time to complete. Verify no browser freezing. Optimize if needed.

tasks.title: 28. Documentation: Add formula explanations
tasks.description: Create 'How It Works' section explaining: grid search approach, Kelly criterion basis, probability calculations, ranking methodology. Use clear examples.

tasks.title: 29. Polish: Add export functionality
tasks.description: Add 'Export to CSV' button. Include all ranked scenarios with full metrics. Format for easy spreadsheet analysis.

tasks.title: 30. Polish: Mobile responsiveness
tasks.description: Test on mobile devices. Make table horizontally scrollable. Stack input/output sections vertically on small screens. Ensure sliders work with touch.

tasks.title: 0. PROJECT OVERVIEW: Profit Optimization Engine
tasks.description:
=== PROFIT OPTIMIZATION ENGINE ===

GOAL: Build an algorithm that finds the optimal leverage and capital-at-risk combinations to maximize absolute dollar profits while managing risk.

=== USER VISION ===
User wants to input constraints and have the system explore different parameter combinations to find what maximizes profit. Instead of manually testing scenarios, the algorithm does it automatically.

=== KEY INPUTS ===
- Available Capital: Starting balance (e.g., $10,000)
- Number of Trades: Total trades to execute (e.g., 100)
- Win Rate: 95-99% (binary outcome: TP or 100% SL loss)
- Expected Asset Movement: Single value % (e.g., 2%)
- Trading Fees: % per side (e.g., 0.1%)

=== VARIABLES TO OPTIMIZE ===
- Leverage: 1x to 15x
- Capital at Risk per trade: 0.5% to 50%

=== OUTPUTS ===
Ranked table of scenarios showing:
1. Leverage used
2. Capital at risk %
3. Net profit ($)
4. Return on capital (%)
5. Max potential loss
6. Probability of ruin
7. Risk profile (Conservative/Moderate/Aggressive)

=== ALGORITHM APPROACH ===
Grid Search with Safety Checks:
1. Test all combinations of leverage  risk %
2. For each combination, calculate:
   - Position size = Capital at risk  Leverage
   - Win amount = Position  Movement % - Fees
   - Loss amount = -100% of capital at risk
   - Expected profit = (Wins  Win amount) - (Losses  Loss amount)
3. Safety checks:
   - Can account survive worst-case losing streak?
   - What is probability of total ruin?
   - Is expected value positive?
4. Rank by absolute $ profit
5. Show multiple options with different risk/reward profiles

=== SENSITIVITY ANALYSIS ===
For top scenarios, test robustness:
- Win rate -20%
- Asset movement -20%
- Fees +20%
- Worst case: all three at once
Show which scenarios remain profitable under stress.

=== MATHEMATICAL FOUNDATION ===
Based on Kelly Criterion adapted for binary outcomes:
- Kelly %  (Win Rate  Win Amount) / Loss Amount
- Modified for high win rate, asymmetric loss scenario
- Position sizing balances growth vs survival

=== EXAMPLE SCENARIO ===
Input:
- Capital: $10,000
- Trades: 100
- Win Rate: 97% (3 losses, 97 wins)
- Movement: 2%
- Fees: 0.1%
- Leverage range: 1-15x
- Risk range: 1-50%

Algorithm finds:
- Rank 1: 15x leverage, 10% risk = $4,250 profit (aggressive)
- Rank 2: 10x leverage, 8% risk = $3,120 profit (moderate)
- Rank 3: 5x leverage, 5% risk = $1,920 profit (conservative)

User can choose based on risk tolerance.

=== KEY DIFFERENTIATORS ===
1. Binary outcomes (TP or 100% loss)
2. Very high win rates (95-99%)
3. Optimize for absolute $ returns
4. Show multiple viable options, not single answer
5. Include safety metrics and warnings
6. Test robustness with sensitivity analysis

=== IMPLEMENTATION LOCATION ===
- New page: /optimization-engine
- Separate from existing /scenario-analysis
- Pull defaults from dashboard stats
- Click-to-run (not real-time)
- Export results to CSV

=== SUCCESS CRITERIA ===
- Can test 1500+ scenarios in <5 seconds
- Accurately calculates profit/loss for all combinations
- Identifies scenarios that would cause ruin
- Ranks scenarios clearly by profit
- Shows warnings for high-risk combinations
- Sensitivity analysis reveals robust vs fragile scenarios
- Mobile responsive
- Exports to CSV for further analysis
